section.title: Presentation of Digital Forensics Framework (DFF)
section.para: DFF is a multi-platform and modular software of digital forensics, distributed free and under Open Source license.
It allows to reveal digital evidence in case of a technical investigation or respond to incidents while preserving the digital integrity
DFF allows to scan disks, get the erased data, analyse flash memory and identify malware on a system with his user interface.
For developers, DFF provides many libraries of specialised programmation for modify and add his own functionalities.

DFF was built and developed to be portable on most of System. It can be used indifferently on some OS : Linux, Unix, Microsoft Windows and MacOS. The multi-tasking architecture of the framework allow automatisation and the parallelisation of analysis, while the integrated development libraries allows the quick add of new functionalities.
Moreover, the community around DFF is active, innovations are continuous and all users can benefit of that improvement.
